subject: Technology
title: Gaming and Mental Health
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Gaming and Mental Health.

hook.text: Games are blamed for violence, addiction, and isolation. The science tells a more complicated story.

buildup.text: Research has found no strong link between violent games and real-world violence. The claim doesn't hold up.

discovery.text: Games can reduce stress, improve problem-solving skills, and provide social connection for isolated people.

twist.text: But excessive gaming can disrupt sleep, grades, and relationships. The World Health Organization now recognizes gaming disorder.

climax.text: Like most technology, games are a tool. The impact depends entirely on how and how much you use them.

punchline.text: Games aren't good or bad. How we use them is.

quiz.question: What does research say about violent games and real-world violence?
options: No strong link has been found
